./.title: Introduction
./.body:
What is Dabao?
Dabao is a tool to build JS bundle of web apps easily and simple, which is based on webpack currently.
The name "Dabao" means "packaging" (and also means "takeaway") in Chinese Pinyin.
Background
Today's web bundling job is too fragmented, over-designed and hard to learn. Each repo has its own special complex bundle config.
Dabao is born to bring a simpler way to config webpack to make it easy to learn, read, create and maintain.
And we focus on web app bundling, especially in teamwork. which means it may not be very much useful to JS lib or personal web app.
Installation & Getting Started
Basic installation:
npm install dabao --global

Basic usage:
dabao app.js --output dist/bundle.js

You can read more about installation and getting started.
Principles
The keypoint of Dabao is "radical" tradeoffs between necessity and fragmentation. It locks some doors which seems easily to be added but hard to maintain and hard to communicate/collaborate with other projects later. At the same time the requirements under them could be solved in another way more clear and maintainable without complicating webpack config.
Another thing Dabao does is make the config more clear and easy for common usage. It find some options which strictly speaking is for several different situations but only one of them web developers often use.
Thrid, Dabao doesn't support very edge syntax / technology. It should be good for business/production team, however it's so cool for JS lib author to do some special job.
In a word, you can only configure what is really necessary.
You may find something different to your habit and no way to customize. But in another way it takes you to some habits which give you more common senses and be able to take more attentions to the "business level" you really care about.
Each tradeoff above has an article here to explain and help you understand why.
Hope you like it and any opinions and ideas are welcome.

installation.html.title: Installation
installation.html.body:
Installation
Global Install
NPM
npm install dabao --global
Yarn
yarn global add dabao
Other Ways
Run with npx Anytime
You can also run dabao with npx which is supported by npm@5.2.0+. See Getting Started
Run with Source Code
If you want to debug dabao, another way to run itself is using link command:
# clone git repo
git clone git@github.com:Jinjiang/dabao.git
cd dabao

# using npm
npm install
npm link

# ... or yarn
yarn
yarn link

getting-started.html.title: Getting Started
getting-started.html.body:
Getting Started
First of all, you need to install Dabao. It's just an one-time shooting.
The Simplest Demo
Create a empty repo and 2 JavaScript files app.js and foo.js.
// app.js
import { foo } from './foo'
foo()

// foo.js
export function foo () {
  console.log('Hello World')
}

export function bar () {
  console.log('Hello World 2')
}

The file app.js is the entry file of this repo. It imports file foo.js.
The whole demo has been here.
Run Dabao
Now we run the command:
$ dabao app.js --output dist/bundle.js

Then you can see a new file dist/bundle.js generated. It's the generated code by Dabao.
The argument --output is to define where to output the generated code (You can also use -o for short).
Hava a Check
Now to have a check, we can run it in Node.js:
$ node dist/bundle.js
> Hello World

Using NPM Scripts
You can also put the command in the toolchain by npm scripts for example:
{
  "name": "dabao-example-simple",
  ...
  "scripts": {
    "build": "dabao app.js -o dist/bundle.js"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "dabao": "*"
  }
}

Using NPX
npx is a new way to run npm packages in npm@5.2.0+. You can just run npx dabao without installing Dabao globally:
npx dabao app.js -o dist/bundle.js

That works the same.

javascript.html.title: JavaScript
javascript.html.body:
JavaScript
Using Babel
Babel is a JavaScript compiler which allow you write code with new syntax today without worry about browser support. We have put babel-loader into default webpack config in Dabao.
We choose babel-preset-env which includes babel-preset-2015, babel-preset-2016 and babel-preset-2017 but exclude stage-x plugins. Because these rules babel-preset-env supports are stable and common enough for both web developers and modern browsers.
Why Babel?
Babel is one the most popular JS compilers. So we choose Babel which is easy to understand.
Why babel-preset-env? My browser has supported ES6.
There are quite amount of users using browser without ES6/7 support. On consideration of common situation first, Dabao chooses babel-preset-env which will compiles all new stable syntax into ES5. And it won't cause obvious side affects in new browsers which has support ES6/7. It even also let developers reproduce and discuss the ways workaround with each others under the same Babel config when they suffer runtime bugs.
What Syntax We May Know But NOT Supported in Dabao?

function binding
decorators

Note: We will consider make a versioning issue to keep the preset upgrading in the future.
TypeScript
TypeScript is not a JS framework exactly. But we put this part here because besides with *.ts files on their own, Dabao could also parse:

in Angular with *.tx files
in React with *.tsx files or *.ts files
in Vue with  in *.vue files

So you can write TypeScript just for free in almost all situations.
Vue (SFC)
Dabao could load *.vue files with vue-loader by default for Vue.js.
You can freely import any *.vue files as normal. For example:
// app.js
const Foo = require('./foo.vue')
console.log(Foo)



  Hello World


And run:
dabao app.js -o dist/bundle.js

will generate a bundle which has converted foo.vue into component definition in JavaScript.
The whole demo has been here.
JSX (React)
Dabao could parse *.jsx file into JavaScript by converting tags into React.createElement(...) because it uses babel-preset-react at the same time. For example:
const Bar = require('./bar.jsx')
console.log(Bar)

// const React = { // for testing
//   createElement: () => '[virtual-DOM]'
// }
module.exports = Hello World

It will generate a file which includes React.createElement("div",null,"Hello World").
The whole demo has been here.
